content:
It sounds like you have a personal connection to the exhibition and the curator, Rachel, which makes it even more special. It's great that you got to see the exhibition before it opened to the public, and I'm sure Rachel was thrilled to share her hard work with you.

Local emerging artists can bring a fresh perspective and unique voice to the art world, and it's wonderful that Rachel is providing a platform for them to showcase their talents. Abstract Expressionism is a fascinating style that can be very expressive and emotive, and I'm sure the exhibition was a treat to experience.

If you don't mind me asking, what were some of your impressions of the exhibition? Were there any particular pieces or artists that stood out to you?
